1242.verse: How can there be for the polytheists a treaty in the sight of Allah and with His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at al-Masjid al-Haram? So as long as they are upright toward you, be upright toward them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].

1243.verse: How [can there be a treaty] while, if they gain dominance over you, they do not observe concerning you any pact of kinship or covenant of protection? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.

1244.verse: They have exchanged the signs of Allah for a small price and averted [people] from His way. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

1245.verse: They do not observe toward a believer any pact of kinship or covenant of protection. And it is they who are the transgressors.

1246.verse: But if they repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.

1247.verse: And if they break their oaths after their treaty and defame your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief, for indeed, there are no oaths [sacred] to them; [fight them that] they might cease.

1248.verse: Would you not fight a people who broke their oaths and determined to expel the Messenger, and they had begun [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right that you should fear Him, if you are [truly] believers.
